moves.3... Bc5: black wants to march up the G pawn and then do Qxf2#
moves.4. Nd5: threatening both Nxf6 and also Nxc7+.
moves.4... Qd6: stopping both treats but trapping the d7 pawn.
moves.5... Nf6: trying to take off the pressure.
moves.6... O-O: black has no choice but to get his king to saftey.
moves.7. Qf3: MORE pressure! at this point black has already lost
moves.7... Nc6: getting the knight into the action.
